DOC.brief_summary: Intraocular pressure significantly increase robot-assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy perform steep trendelenburg position prolong time pneumoperitoneum . Therefore investigator decide evaluate impact surgical visibility deep neuromuscular blockade intraocular pressure patient undergo Robot-Assisted Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy .
DOC.brief_title: The Impacts Surgical Visibility Through Deep Neuromuscular Blockade Intraocular Pressure Patients Undergoing Robot-Assisted Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy
DOC.criteria: 1 . ASA class III 2. obtain write informed consent parent 3. age 50 year undergo robot assist laparoscopic prostatectomy 1. eye surgery previously 2. unstable angina congestive heart failure 3. concomitant eye disease ( glaucoma , diabetic retinopathy , cataract , retinal detachment ) 4. high intraocular pressure 30mmHg screen test . 5. uncontrolled hypertension ( diastolic bp > 110mmHg ) 6. coagulopathy 7. asthma 8. hepatic failure 9. renal failure ( creatinine clearance < 30 ml/min ) 10. drug hyperactivity 11. neurological psychiatric illness 12. mental retardation 13. patient ` read consent form due illiterate foreigner 14. previous malignant hyperthermia Hx 15. drug medication interact muscle relaxant ( anticonvulsant , certain antibiotic , magnesium etc ) 16 . BMI > 30kg/m2
